Introduction
My research area is plant evolutionary biology, genomics, phylogenetics, systematics, population genetics, and taxonomy. My major focus is upon parasitic flowering plants, particularly the sandalwood order (Santalales). In addition to molecular data, I also study the “whole plant” via examination of plant anatomy and morphology. I am involved in several floristic projects and these are tied to my interest in photographic documentation.

Projects

Project (1)
Parasitic plants - and more!
Project
I am working on a number of projects at this time, most of which involve parasitic plants. Here is a general overview: 1. Thesium. With coauthor Miguel García, we are preparing a molecular phylogeny of the genus. 2. Loranthaceae. I have several projects underway with this family: • Working with Carlos Reif, we are generating a molecular phylogeny of the small-flowered neotropical loranths (i.e. those related to Struthanthus). • There are several new species of loranths to be named from the Philippines and Papua New Guinea. Getting access to specimens from the former area has slowed progress here. • Working with Sarah Mathews (CSIRO, Australia), we are looking at morphological and molecular variation in the genus Amyema and relatives. • Working with Lauren Raz, Xavier Marquinez Casas and students in Bogotá, Colombia, we are examining gynoecium anatomy in Loranthaceae. 3. As part of a team called the Santalales Working Group (J. Der, O. Seberg, G. Petersen, K. Neubig, H.-J. Su) we are looking at plastome evolution in the order (including Balanophoraceae, Mystropetalaceae). 4. Rafflesia. Various projects including: • Host relationships (with Pieter Pelser, Julie Barcelona) - see recent paper in Taxon. • Relationships among Philippine Rafflesia species • Genomics 5. Plant photography and the PhytoImages database. Several projects tied to this database, including: • Illinois Plants: Wild Plants of the Prairie State http://www.inhs.illinois.edu/data/plantdb • Co's Digital Flora of the Philippines http://www.philippineplants.org/ • Parasitic Plant Connection http://parasiticplants.siu.edu/
